ovdesc.p: All T24 screens have been designed within a set structure and most Data Sections of the screen are very similar (one field per line with enrichment of 35 characters per field).

The VERSION file has been developed to enable Users to redesign the Data Section (line 5 to line 20) of any T24. screen to suit their own preferences/requirements. An infinite number of versions of each screen can be created, and are then called up by appending ',X' (where X = Version identity) to the Application name.
Basically, the VERSION file is organised in three sections:
1. The first section defines general information such as :
. Print or Screen identification. . Number of records per page. . Number of fields per line. . Languages. . Headers.
2. The second section enables the layout of fields to be arranged on the screen, field descriptions to be defined in any language and length of enrichments to be specified.
3. The third section enables the User to define operating conditions specific to the Version being created by means of parameters such as :
. Number of authorisation(s) . Definition of 'No-input' fields . Definition of 'No-change' fields . Fields to be rekeyed for authorisation . Automatic default values

This information, generated automatically by the System, allows the User to check on-line the position on the screen of the different fields being creating in the Version. The format of the field thus defines:
1. In which column the Text previously defined will start and,
2. the total length generated by the field (including Text, input itself and the enrichment defined in the previous fields and necessary spaces between fields on the same line).
Example:
If this field displays the information : 1|18
where:
1 indicates that the field starts in column 1 and
18 indicates that the field uses 18 columns on the screen or report.

In the above example (1|18), the System is telling the User that this field will start in column 1 and uses in total 18 columns. If he wants to define a second field on the same line, the second field can only be defined starting from at least column 19 i.e. 1 + 18. If the User enters a column number smaller than 19, the System would then automatically place this field on the next line.

NAU.PROCESSING
This field facilitates to specify optional functionality for the processing of transactions via OFS where $NAU records exist.
This field helps to handle situations where data is passed through OFS to T24 and records with the same ID exist on the $NAU files.
This field has the following options:
0. Reject messages where an NAU record exists.

1. Overwrite NAU record with OFS data, i.e. fields from the OFS record will be written to the NAU record. If the VERSION has 0 authorisers and the user associated with the OFS message, is the only user on the NAU record then process as normal. If the USERs are not the same, write the OFS field data onto the NAU record and write the record to the unauthorised file.
2. Accept Reversal as Deletion (or deletion of NAU record + reversal of live record if live record exists) if an NAU record exists.
3. Apply both option 1 and option 2 to this version. i.e. If OFS transaction is an Input then process as per option 1. If OFS transaction is Reversal process as per option 2.
If the field is left empty the existing functionality will apply.

The following validations/processing is done based on the fields SERVICE and ACTIVITY.

If both SERVICE and ACTIVITY do not exist, then a new activity is created in PW.ACTIVITY, with the TARGET field mapped to the Version/Function and a new record is created in EB.SERVICE with the activity added to it.
If the SERVICE is existing EB.SERVICE and ACTIVITY does not exist in PW.ACTIVITY,a new activity is created in PW.ACTIVITY and the same is appended to the EB.SERVICE record.

If SERVICE does not exist and ACTIVITY exists, a check is done to ensure that the activity relates to this Version/Function, i.e. the TARGET field in PW.ACTIVITY is mapped correctly, otherwise an error message is thrown. Then, a new EB.SERVICE record is created with the activity added to it.

If both SERVICE and ACTIVITY exists and the activity relates to the Version/Function, a check is done to ensure that the EB.SERVICE does not contain the ACTIVITY.ID already.Otherwise an error message is thrown. Finally,EB.SERVICE is updated with the activity appended to it.

Only the value(s) defined in the various occurrences of FIELD NO. will be displayed, even if the application record contains more values.
Example: Let us suppose that Field 12 (OTHER OFFICER) from the CUSTOMER file has been defined as follows :

12.1 with column 1, 12.2 with column 40 and the field Expansion has been left blank. In this case, column 1 will be used for Fields 12.1, 12.3, 12.5 etc... while column 40 will be used for Fields 12.2, 12.4, 12.6 etc...

NO The User will not be able to expand the multivalue or sub-value field. blankIt can be expanded by the User during the on-line session when using this Version. Multivalue field associated with Fields 13 to 23. (Optional input. Default value = blank.)

The system will not accept a mix of Expansion and No Expansion of fields with the same field number or fields in the same group of associated fields. For example, Field 12 (OTHER OFFICER) from the CUSTOMER file cannot be defined as 12.1 with expansion and 12.2 without expansion. Input in this field must be in accordance with the field definition of the selected Application. Quotes should only be used where the new data actually requires quotes e.g if a new value is required to be YES it should not be input as "YES".
It is important to clearly understand the relation between this field and AUTOMATIC OLD CONTENT. The following examples will clarify their use.
1. When the User wants to create an automatic default at the creation of new record ID's, he should then make the following input in these three fields :

AUTOMATIC FIELD NUMBER - Indicates the field number for which you want to create an automatic default. AUTOMATIC OLD CONTENT - Must remain blank. AUTOMATIC NEW CONTENT - Enter the value which you want to default automatically.
2. When you want to replace automatically an old content by a new content, you should then make the following input in these three fields :
AUTOMATIC FIELD NUMBER - Indicate the field number for which you want to change automatically the old content.
AUTOMATIC OLD CONTENT - Enter the old content AUTOMATIC NEW CONTENT - Enter the new content which you want to replace automatically.
3. When you want to run a subroutine which will default a value in a particular field, you should make the following input in these three fields :
AUTOMATIC FIELD NUMBER - Indicates the field number for which you want to create a automatic default AUTOMATIC OLD CONTENT - Must remain blank AUTOMATIC NEW CONTENT - Enter the subroutine name
which needs to be executed for the the field in AUTOMATIC.FIELD.NUMBER.

desc.p: Controls how GTS and OFS will handle error conditions for activities using this version record. The following values are allowed :
Null (Reject errors / Approve overrides)
GTS

Validation errors will result in the record being rejected, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (90) Overrides will be accepted by default, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with the acceptance code (00).
OFS

Validation errors will result in the record being rejected, the OFS data record will be returned with details of the error message. Overrides will be accepted by default, the overrides will be returned in the populated OFS data record.
1 (Errors on HLD / Approve Overrides)
GTS

Validation errors will place the record on hold, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (80). Overrides will be accepted by default the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with the acceptance code (00).
OFS

Validation errors will place the record on hold, the OFS data record will be returned with the error messages. Overrides will be accepted by default, the values approved will be returned in the populated OFS record.
2 (Errors Rejected / Overrides in HLD)
GTS

Validation errors will result in the record being rejected, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (90). Overrides will result in the record being placed on hold, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (81).
OFS
Validation errors will result in the record being rejected, the OFS data record will be returned with the error messages. Overrides will result in the record being placed on hold.
3 (Errors in HLD / Overrides HLD)
GTS

Validation errors will place the record on hold, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (80). Overrides will result in the record being placed on hold, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (81).
OFS

Validation errors will place the record on hold, the OFS data record will be returned with the error messages. Overrides will result in the record being placed on hold, the OFS data record returned will store the override message.
4 (Hold Only)
GTS
This option is not available using GTS. Messages can be written straight to HLD using the GTS.MODE field in GT.SYSTEM.PARAMETER.
OFS

If field validation (FIELD.VAL in OFS.SOURCE) is not set then this setting will place all records in HLD status immediately, and no further validation or processing will take place. If field validation is set (FIELD.VAL=YES) then any field validation errors will cause the record put into HLD also OFS data record will be returned with the error messages.

Provides the User with the facility to define some fields as fully protected so that, when using this Version, it will be impossible to input to, or amend the content of, these fields.
It is important to note that the field name input automatically includes all possible value and sub-value fields of that field. (Local Reference fields can also be input.)

A typical example of use of this facility could be illustrated by a Money Market contract or Foreign Exchange transaction which has been initiated in the dealing room (1st level input) and which will be completed by the back-office department. Very often, the input from the dealer has to be protected and could only be changed by himself. It is then possible to define a Version for the back-office department which, by the use of this field, can restrict the back-office staff from amending the data input in the dealing room.

Enables the second line of headings for columns 01 to 39, of the screen or printed report, to be specified.

This second heading line will appear on line number 3 in the header lines. Spaces will not be ignored. When the ID is displayed on line 3 (see value of REFERENCE NO IN 1ST LINE, Field 25), this header will only be displayed starting from page 2.

The Language codes define the languages of the headings in the corresponding group of Fields 5 to 12 (e.g. if Field 4.2 specifies French, the System assumes that headings in Fields 5.2 to 12.2 are in French and will display them for Users whose Profiles specify French).
If the standard Version of the Application displays information on header line 3, the heading defined in this Field will be overwritten.
Note: When this field is expanded to define the headers in various languages, the user should enter these in the same language sequence as the one defined in LANGUAGE CODE (Field 4).

Field that contains the ID of a PW.ACTIVITY record. It may be an existing record. If the record is not present, then upon authorising the VERSION, a new record is created.
The ID of the new PW.ACTIVITY record created through the VERSION will have the prefix 'WS.'
1. Length of 35 alphanumeric characters
2. If EXPOSE is set to 'YES', then this field is mandatory
3. No-input if EXPOSE is not set to 'YES'
The following validations/processing is done based on the fields SERVICE and ACTIVITY.

If both SERVICE and ACTIVITY do not exist, then a new activity is created in PW.ACTIVITY, with the TARGET field mapped to the Version/Function and a new record is created in EB.SERVICE with the activity added to it.
If the SERVICE is existing EB.SERVICE and ACTIVITY does not exist in PW.ACTIVITY,a new activity is created in PW.ACTIVITY and the same is appended to the EB.SERVICE record.

If SERVICE does not exist and ACTIVITY exists, a check is done to ensure that the activity relates to this Version/Function, i.e. the TARGET field in PW.ACTIVITY is mapped correctly, otherwise an error message is thrown. Then, a new EB.SERVICE record is created with the activity added to it.

If both SERVICE and ACTIVITY exists and the activity relates to the Version/Function, a check is done to ensure that the EB.SERVICE does not contain the ACTIVITY.ID already.Otherwise an error message is thrown. Finally,EB.SERVICE is updated with the activity appended to it.
